block.p: An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items may be submitted by mail, at least three weeks in advance, to Westchester Cultural Calendar, North Salem, N.Y. 10560.
THEATER

BEDFORD PARK -- ''Little Red Riding Hood -- The Real Story'' and ''Rip Van Winkle and Friends,'' performed by members of Belmont Italian-American Playhouse; with music arranged by Bill Scribner and presented by Bronx Arts Ensemble. Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $7, including grounds admission; parking, $5. Lecture hall of New York Botanical Garden, 200th Street and Kazimiroff Boulevard. (718) 601-7399.

ELMSFORD -- ''Grease.'' Today at 1:30 p.m. with lunch at noon and 7 p.m. with dinner at 5; Wednesday and Thursday at 1 p.m. with lunch at 11:30 a.m. and 8 p.m. with dinner at 6 and Friday and next Saturday at 8 p.m. with dinner at 6. Tickets: $46 to $66. Westchester Broadway Theater, 1 Broadway Plaza. (914) 592-2222.

GARRISON -- Hudson Valley Shakespeare Festival presents ''Measure for Measure.'' Previews Wednesday and Thursday at 7 p.m. and Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $17. Next Saturday at 8 p.m. and next Sunday at 6 p.m. Tickets: $28 and $30. Discount available for students, older people and children, except Saturday evenings. Through July 30. Boscobel Restoration, 1601 Route 9D. (845) 265-7858.
NEW ROCHELLE -- Moonlight Theater performs the comedy ''Line'' by Israel Horovitz. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $10. Trinity-St. Paul's Episcopal Church, 311 Huguenot Street. (914) 633-3339.

PURCHASE -- Play Group Theater for Children and Young Adults presents the musical ''Bridge to Terabithia.'' Today at 1 and 7 p.m. Tickets: $15; students and older people, $12; children, $10. Little Theater, Manhattanville College. (914) 946-0649.
MUSIC AND DANCE
CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- Clearwater's Great Hudson River Revival. Today from 10 a.m. to dusk. Admission: $30; students, older people and the disabled, $20. Croton Point Park. (914) 454-7673.
DOBBS FERRY -- Harvie Swartz and his Latin jazz group Eye Contact. Part of Dobbs Ferry summer music series. Wednesday at 6:30 to 8 p.m. Free. Waterfront Park. (914) 631-1000.

KATONAH -- Opening night of Caramoor international music festival, featuring Yo-Yo Ma, cellist; Orchestra of St. Luke's, conducted by Peter Oundjian; Edward Arron, cellist. Performing works by Vivaldi, Elgar and Stravinsky. Next Saturday at 7 p.m. Tickets: $20 to $65. 232-1252. Tickets: $350 to $1,000 with cocktails, dinner and dancing. (914) 232-1492. Misha Dichter, pianist, performs works by Beethoven, Schumann, Scriabin, Prokofiev and Rachmaninoff. Next Sunday at 4:30 p.m., with pre-concert conversation at 3:30. Tickets: $25 and $35. (914) 232-1252. Caramoor, Girdle Ridge Road.

MAMARONECK -- Folk singer and storyteller, Freedy Johnston, with opening by the Lonesome Brothers. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $20; members, $15; $52 for series with Catie Curtis on July 27 and John Gorka on Aug. 3. Emelin Theater, Library Lane. (914) 698-0098.
MOUNT VERNON -- Louisiana's Kenny Neal. Tonight at 9. Tickets: $40 with dinner; $20 at the bar (not including drinks). Bayou Restaurant, 580 Gramatan Avenue. (914) 668-2634.

PAWLING -- Singer and songwriter, Lucy Kaplansky, with guest artist, Pat Donohue. Tonight at 8. Tickets: $20; members, $17.50. Open mike night, with host, Scott Sylvester. Wednesday at 7 p.m., with performers signing in from 5 to 7. Tickets: $4. Singer and songwriter, Jim Dawson, with Lui Collins and Dana Robinson. Friday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $17.50; members, $15. Tony Trischka Band with guest artist, Robert Hill. Next Saturday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $17.50; members, $15. Towne Crier Cafe, 130 Route 22. (845) 855-1300.

PEEKSKILL -- Jazz, big band swing, love songs and popular standards by vocalist, Doug Ferone, and Ferony Show Band. Fridays at 7:30 p.m. No cover. Quarter Note Cafe, Welcher Avenue and Washington Street. (914) 737-3287.

PLEASANTVILLE -- Westchester Girls Choir; David Graf, music director. Concert includes works from ''Frostiana,'' ''Carmen'' and ''The Little Mermaid.'' Today at 4 p.m. Free. Emanuel Lutheran Church. (914) 472-6652.
PURCHASE -- Doug Varone and Dancers. Next Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $20. Performing Arts Center, Purchase College. (914) 251-6200.

RYE -- Classical pianist, Ronald Meyer, performs works by Schumann, Debussy, Beethoven, Brahms and Chopin. Presented by Rye Arts Center and Wainwright House. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15, including dessert reception after recital; students and older people, $10. Wainwright House, 260 Stuyvesant Avenue. (914) 967-0700.

SCARBOROUGH -- Chamber Dance Project's dancers and musicians; Diane Coburn Bruning, artistic director. Concert includes two world premieres, with dancers from American Ballet Theater, Pennsylvania Ballet, Twyla Tharp and Les Grands Ballet Canadiens. Next Sunday at 7 p.m., with cocktails at 6 and dessert and discussion after performance. Tickets: $100 (with $60 tax deductible) to $250 (with $210 tax deductible). Sleepy Hollow Country Club. (914) 332-7762.
YONKERS -- Concert by Westchester Be-Bop Delight. Today at noon. Free. Bronx River Parkway Reservation, Scarsdale Road. (914) 242-7275.
ART

BRONXVILLE -- ''The Photographic Image: A Roving Eye,'' contemporary works by Herbert Ascherman, Larry Davis, Michael Gesinger and others and vintage prints by Louis Stettner and from the estate of Lee Sievan. Opening reception Friday from 5 to 8 p.m. Through Sept. 8. Noel Fine Art, 80 Kraft Avenue. (914) 337-4050.

GARRISON -- Photography of the world of the Celts of Ireland, Wales and England by Sarah Griffin Banker and an installation by Carinda Swann. Through July 2. Garrison Art Center, just west of the junction of Routes 9D and 403. (845) 424-3960.

KATONAH -- ''Hope Photographs,'' testimony to the resilience of the human spirit, by 90 art and documentary photographers. William Wegman's Weimaraners created for his children's books. Through July 4. ''Emily Feinstein: Sites Unseen,'' three outdoor sculptures with window openings, to highlight the trees in the sculpture garden and to allow visitors to look inside the structures. Admission: $3; children, free. Katonah Museum of Art, Route 22 at Jay Street. (914) 232-9555.
MOUNT KISCO -- ''Gone Fishin','' juried show. Opens Friday. Through July 30. Northern Westchester Center for the Arts, 272 North Bedford Road. (914) 241-6922.
NEW ROCHELLE -- New Rochelle Art Association's Jules Bauer award show. Reception Friday from 5 to 7 p.m. New Rochelle Public Library, Library Plaza. (914) 632-7878.
PLEASANTVILLE -- Retrospective of art by Raymond deLucia. Through Friday. Mount Pleasant Public Library, 350 Bedford Road. (914) 769-0548.
PORT CHESTER -- ''Michael Simon: Shapes and Surface,'' fired pots by artist. Opening reception Friday from 6 to 8 p.m. Through July 22. Clay Art Center, 40 Beech Street. (914) 937-2047.

PURCHASE -- Whitfield Lovell heads a tour of his installations titled ''Whitfield Lovell: Portrayals.'' Wednesday at noon. Free with museum admission of $4; students and people 62 and older, $3; children, free. Bring bag lunch or buy lunch in museum's cafe. Neuberger Museum of Art, Purchase College. (914) 251-6100.
SHRUB OAK -- Exhibition by members of Northern Westchester Watercolor Society. Through June 29. John C. Hart Memorial Library, 1130 Main Street. (914) 245-5262.
VALHALLA -- ''Summer Palette,'' paintings by 14 artists. Through Sept. 1. Gallery of Macy Pavilion, Westchester Medical Center. (914) 493-8397.

YONKERS -- ''Open Air Sketching: 19th-Century American Landscape Drawings in the Albany Institute of History and Art'' and viewing the recently renovated Glenview Mansion. Wednesdays through Sundays from noon to 5 p.m. and Fridays from 5 to 9 p.m. Admission: $4; people 62 and older and children, $3. Multimedia tours of Glenview Mansion by Emily Trevor, youngest daughter of the family that originally owned the house. Today and next Saturday and Sunday at 1 and 3 p.m. Admission: $7, including museum admission; people 62 and older and children, $5. (Recommended for children 10 through 12.) Hudson River Museum, 511 Warburton Avenue. (914) 963-4550.
LECTURES
BEDFORD -- Latest information on Lyme disease by Susan Tobias of the Lyme Disease Institute. Wednesday at 7 p.m. Free. Westmoreland Sanctuary, 260 Chestnut Ridge Road. (914) 666-8448.

CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- Fred Opie examines Afro-North American labor migration and the Guatemalan railroad worker's league of 1884-1921. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Croton Free Library, 171 Cleveland Drive. (914) 271-6612.

HARRISON -- Lunch meeting with Peter Passidomo, chief court attorney of the Family Court of New York State discussing ''Balancing Justice.'' Presented by League of Women Voters of Harrison. Wednesday at noon. Tickets: $10. Harrison Public Library, Bruce Avenue. (914) 939-7066.

PURCHASE -- ''Animal Empire: Wolves and Wildlife in Portrait.'' Scott Barry shares his observations of wolves, buffalo and other wildlife. Tomorrow at 8 p.m. Friends Meetinghouse, Route 120. (914) 234-7533.

WHITE PLAINS -- Basic Internet lecture, presented by member of library staff. Tomorrow from 7 to 8:30 p.m. ''Genealogy on the Internet,'' demonstration also presented by member of library staff. Wednesday from 7 to 8:30 p.m. Free. White Plains Public Library, 100 Martine Avenue. (914) 422-1480.

YONKERS -- ''On the Streets Where We Live, 1900-2000,'' slide show especially for people 62 and older, by Tom Flynn. Wednesday 1:30 p.m. Cost: $1.50, including museum admission. Hudson River Museum, 511 Warburton Avenue. (914) 963-4550.
FILMS
CHAPPAQUA -- ''Strictly Ballroom.'' Thursday at 7 p.m. Free. Chappaqua Library, 195 South Greeley Avenue. (914) 238-4779.
PEEKSKILL -- ''East-West,'' French and Russian film with English subtitles. Thursday through next Saturday at 8 p.m. $9. Paramount Center, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 739-2333.
CHILDREN

BEDFORD -- Hike in search of salamanders, insects, millipedes and toads, which call the forest floor their home and learn why these animals are important to the health of woodlands. Program for children 6 and older. Today at 2 p.m. Children's nature hike, in search of tracks, deer bones, owl pellets and bird nests. Next Saturday at 2 p.m. Free. Westmoreland Sanctuary, 260 Chestnut Ridge Road. (914) 666-8448.

GREENBURGH -- ''Nature Bugs,'' children 3 and 4 with parent or caregiver take part in nature walk, visiting live animals and making a craft or playing hide and seek. Tomorrow from 1:30 to 2:30 p.m. Rain or shine. Children 3 to 5 and parents enjoy a walk, live animals and stories. Wednesday from 10 to 11 a.m. Admission: $4 each; children, $2. ''Turtle Trek,'' family members search the grounds for turtle treasures. Next Sunday at 2 p.m. Admission: $8, including refreshments and prizes; $5 with pre-paid registration by today. ''Amazing Adaptations,'' natural history exhibit for all ages, focusing on the ways animals and plants adapt to their environment. Hands-on activities and live animals and plants are included. Today from 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., tomorrow through Thursday from 9:30 to 4:30 p.m. and next Saturday and Sunday from 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Admission: $4; students and people 62 and older, $3; children, $2. Greenburgh Nature Center, Dromore Road. (914) 723-3470.
NORTH WHITE PLAINS -- Dragonfly program. Next Saturday at 10 a.m. Free. Cranberry Lake Preserve. (914) 428-1005.

OSSINING -- Kick-off of Jesse Bear Read-to-Me Club, featuring children's entertainer, Graham Clarke. For first graders and younger children. Tuesday at 2 p.m. Free. Ossining Public Library, 53 Croton Avenue. 941-2416.

OSSINING -- Nature by Design, family hike looking at patterns and textures of nature; with leaf, bark and stone rubbings. Next Saturday from 10:30 to 11:30 a.m. Admission: $12 a family; member family, $10. Registration. ''Don't Bug Me!'' Children 8 and 9 scramble on the ground in search of invertebrates. Next Sunday at 1:30 to 2:30 p.m. Admission: $8; members, $6. Registration. Meet at nature center of Teatown Lake Reservation, 1600 Spring Valley Road. (914) 762-2912.

PURCHASE -- ''Art About Town,'' children 5 through 8 take part in art workshops and explore the Neuberger Museum of Art's exhibitions, the college grounds and PepsiCo Sculpture Gardens. June 26 through June 30 from 10 a.m. to noon. Cost: $100; child of museum member, $80. Registration. Purchase College. (914) 251-6100.

SOMERS -- Demonstrations and education about horses. Today from noon to 3 p.m. ''Garden Day,'' program for children 3 through 5. Thursday from 10 to 11 a.m. Cost: $5. Registration. Muscoot Farm, Route 100. (914) 232-7118.

WHITE PLAINS -- Bike and skate Sundays, with Bronx River Parkway closed to vehicular traffic and open to bicyclists and skaters. Today and next Sunday from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. Free. Bicycling course begins at County Center in White Plains and runs south to Scarsdale Road in Yonkers, 14 miles round trip. In-line roller skating course runs north from the County Center to Fisher Lane in North White Plains, two miles round trip. (914) 242-7275.

WHITE PLAINS -- ''Informance,'' Doug Varone and Dancers illustrate how dances are created and the interplay of dance and music. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Free. White Plains Public Library, 100 Martine Avenue. (914) 422-4276.

YONKERS -- Sky shows: ''The Sky Tonight,'' for children 8 and older and adults. Saturdays and Sundays at 1:30 p.m. ''Rusty Rocket's Last Blast,'' for children 6 and older and accompanying adults. Saturdays and Sundays at 2:30 p.m. ''The Start of It All,'' for children 10 and older and adults. Today at 3:30 p.m. ''Earth and Sky,'' for children 8 and older and adults. Next Saturday and Sunday at 3:30 p.m. Tickets: $4 each: people 62 and older and children, $3; one sky show and admission to museum's galleries, $7; people 62 and older and children, $5. ''The Sky Tonight.'' Fridays at 7 p.m., with free tickets at the front desk beginning at 6:30. Hudson River Museum, 511 Warburton Avenue. (914) 963-4550.
POTPOURRI

CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- ''Summer Savories,'' open hearth cooking workshop using authentic 18th-century recipes. Next Saturday from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. Admission: $40, including refreshments and tour of museum; members of Historic Hudson Valley, $35. Registration. 631-8200, ext. 628. ''Sweet Scents, Bitter Pills,'' 18th-century herbal medicine workshop for remedies, sweet scents and the treatment of disease. Next Sunday from 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. Admission: $40, including light refreshments; members of Historic Hudson Valley, $35. Registration. (914) 631-8200, ext. 618. Van Cortlandt Manor.

GARRISON -- Program for Russel Wright collectors and design enthusiasts, with talks, exhibits and panel discussions, ''The Making of Dragon Rock'' and ''Evolution of Iroquois Casual China.'' Next Saturday from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. with cocktail reception at Dragon Rock from 5 to 7 p.m. Tickets: $60. Reservations. Manitoga, Route 9D. (845) 424-3812.
HARTSDALE -- American Kennel Club dog agility show. Today from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. Ridge Road Park. (914) 452-4453.

NYACK -- ''Edward Hopper House Garden Walk,'' self-guided walking tour of the gardens of eight summer estates along the Hudson River. Next Saturday 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Rain or shine. Tickets: $15. Available at Hopper House, 82 North Broadway or at 507 North Broadway in Upper Nyack. (845) 358-0774.

NEW CITY -- ''Leaving Her Mark: A Celebration of Women in Rockland County History,'' exhibition highlighting women from the 18th through 21st centuries. Opens today from 1 to 5 p.m. Thereafter: Tuesdays through Sundays from 1 to 5 p.m. Donation: $4, including free guided tours of Jacob Blauvelt House, an 1830's restoration with Hudson Valley furnishings. Historical Society of Rockland County, 20 Zukor Road. (845) 634-9645.

NEW ROCHELLE -- Indoor summer cycling classes; a 45-minute workout for cardiovascular conditioning. Class for beginners is also offered. Weekdays. Cost: $96 for eight classes; members, $80. Jewish Community Center of Mid-Westchester, 999 Wilmot Road. (914) 472-3300, ext. 326.
OSSINING -- Walking tour of historic Sparta section of Ossining, led by John Lee. Today at 1 p.m. Free. Meet at Jug Tavern, 74 Revolutionary Road.

OSSINING -- Guided tours of Wildflower Island, a two-acre sanctuary, which is home to hundreds of native and endangered species of wildflowers. Saturdays and Sundays at 2 p.m. Admission: $3; members of Teatown, $2; Friends of Wildflower Island, free. (Children 13 and younger are not permitted on the island.) Reservations. Teatown Lake Reservation, 1600 Spring Valley Road. (914) 762-2912.

PUTNAM VALLEY -- Strawberry festival, strawberry shortcake, arts and crafts and flea market. Next Saturday from 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. Tompkins Corners Methodist Church, 729 Peekskill Hollow Road. (845) 528-5076.

TARRYTOWN -- Rockefeller State Park Preserve, featuring woodlands, wetlands, a 24-acre lake and 20 miles of trails (for carriage use originally) for strolling, hiking and nature study. Open daily from 8 a.m. to dusk. Parking: $4 daily; people 62 and older on nonholiday weekdays only, free. Enter on Route 117, a mile east of Route 9, to obtain trail map at visitors center. (Visitors center open daily from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m.) (914) 631-1470.

TARRYTOWN -- Family communications workshop. Learn to listen and communicate more effectively. Thursday 8 to 9:15 p.m. Cost: $18; members, $12. Jewish Community Center, 371 South Broadway. (914) 366-7898.

An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items may be submitted by mail, at least three weeks in advance, to Westchester Cultural Calendar, North Salem, N.Y. 10560.
THEATER

BEDFORD PARK -- ''Little Red Riding Hood -- The Real Story'' and ''Rip Van Winkle and Friends,'' performed by members of Belmont Italian-American Playhouse; with music arranged by Bill Scribner and presented by Bronx Arts Ensemble. Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $7, including grounds admission; parking, $5. Lecture hall of New York Botanical Garden, 200th Street and Kazimiroff Boulevard. (718) 601-7399.

ELMSFORD -- ''Grease.'' Today at 1:30 p.m. with lunch at noon and 7 p.m. with dinner at 5; Wednesday and Thursday at 1 p.m. with lunch at 11:30 a.m. and 8 p.m. with dinner at 6 and Friday and next Saturday at 8 p.m. with dinner at 6. Tickets: $46 to $66. Westchester Broadway Theater, 1 Broadway Plaza. (914) 592-2222.

GARRISON -- Hudson Valley Shakespeare Festival presents ''Measure for Measure.'' Previews Wednesday and Thursday at 7 p.m. and Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $17. Next Saturday at 8 p.m. and next Sunday at 6 p.m. Tickets: $28 and $30. Discount available for students, older people and children, except Saturday evenings. Through July 30. Boscobel Restoration, 1601 Route 9D. (845) 265-7858.
NEW ROCHELLE -- Moonlight Theater performs the comedy ''Line'' by Israel Horovitz. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $10. Trinity-St. Paul's Episcopal Church, 311 Huguenot Street. (914) 633-3339.

PURCHASE -- Play Group Theater for Children and Young Adults presents the musical ''Bridge to Terabithia.'' Today at 1 and 7 p.m. Tickets: $15; students and older people, $12; children, $10. Little Theater, Manhattanville College. (914) 946-0649.
MUSIC AND DANCE
CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- Clearwater's Great Hudson River Revival. Today from 10 a.m. to dusk. Admission: $30; students, older people and the disabled, $20. Croton Point Park. (914) 454-7673.
DOBBS FERRY -- Harvie Swartz and his Latin jazz group Eye Contact. Part of Dobbs Ferry summer music series. Wednesday at 6:30 to 8 p.m. Free. Waterfront Park. (914) 631-1000.

KATONAH -- Opening night of Caramoor international music festival, featuring Yo-Yo Ma, cellist; Orchestra of St. Luke's, conducted by Peter Oundjian; Edward Arron, cellist. Performing works by Vivaldi, Elgar and Stravinsky. Next Saturday at 7 p.m. Tickets: $20 to $65. 232-1252. Tickets: $350 to $1,000 with cocktails, dinner and dancing. (914) 232-1492. Misha Dichter, pianist, performs works by Beethoven, Schumann, Scriabin, Prokofiev and Rachmaninoff. Next Sunday at 4:30 p.m., with pre-concert conversation at 3:30. Tickets: $25 and $35. (914) 232-1252. Caramoor, Girdle Ridge Road.

MAMARONECK -- Folk singer and storyteller, Freedy Johnston, with opening by the Lonesome Brothers. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $20; members, $15; $52 for series with Catie Curtis on July 27 and John Gorka on Aug. 3. Emelin Theater, Library Lane. (914) 698-0098.
MOUNT VERNON -- Louisiana's Kenny Neal. Tonight at 9. Tickets: $40 with dinner; $20 at the bar (not including drinks). Bayou Restaurant, 580 Gramatan Avenue. (914) 668-2634.

PAWLING -- Singer and songwriter, Lucy Kaplansky, with guest artist, Pat Donohue. Tonight at 8. Tickets: $20; members, $17.50. Open mike night, with host, Scott Sylvester. Wednesday at 7 p.m., with performers signing in from 5 to 7. Tickets: $4. Singer and songwriter, Jim Dawson, with Lui Collins and Dana Robinson. Friday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $17.50; members, $15. Tony Trischka Band with guest artist, Robert Hill. Next Saturday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $17.50; members, $15. Towne Crier Cafe, 130 Route 22. (845) 855-1300.

PEEKSKILL -- Jazz, big band swing, love songs and popular standards by vocalist, Doug Ferone, and Ferony Show Band. Fridays at 7:30 p.m. No cover. Quarter Note Cafe, Welcher Avenue and Washington Street. (914) 737-3287.

PLEASANTVILLE -- Westchester Girls Choir; David Graf, music director. Concert includes works from ''Frostiana,'' ''Carmen'' and ''The Little Mermaid.'' Today at 4 p.m. Free. Emanuel Lutheran Church. (914) 472-6652.
PURCHASE -- Doug Varone and Dancers. Next Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $20. Performing Arts Center, Purchase College. (914) 251-6200.

RYE -- Classical pianist, Ronald Meyer, performs works by Schumann, Debussy, Beethoven, Brahms and Chopin. Presented by Rye Arts Center and Wainwright House. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15, including dessert reception after recital; students and older people, $10. Wainwright House, 260 Stuyvesant Avenue. (914) 967-0700.

SCARBOROUGH -- Chamber Dance Project's dancers and musicians; Diane Coburn Bruning, artistic director. Concert includes two world premieres, with dancers from American Ballet Theater, Pennsylvania Ballet, Twyla Tharp and Les Grands Ballet Canadiens. Next Sunday at 7 p.m., with cocktails at 6 and dessert and discussion after performance. Tickets: $100 (with $60 tax deductible) to $250 (with $210 tax deductible). Sleepy Hollow Country Club. (914) 332-7762.
YONKERS -- Concert by Westchester Be-Bop Delight. Today at noon. Free. Bronx River Parkway Reservation, Scarsdale Road. (914) 242-7275.
ART

BRONXVILLE -- ''The Photographic Image: A Roving Eye,'' contemporary works by Herbert Ascherman, Larry Davis, Michael Gesinger and others and vintage prints by Louis Stettner and from the estate of Lee Sievan. Opening reception Friday from 5 to 8 p.m. Through Sept. 8. Noel Fine Art, 80 Kraft Avenue. (914) 337-4050.

GARRISON -- Photography of the world of the Celts of Ireland, Wales and England by Sarah Griffin Banker and an installation by Carinda Swann. Through July 2. Garrison Art Center, just west of the junction of Routes 9D and 403. (845) 424-3960.

KATONAH -- ''Hope Photographs,'' testimony to the resilience of the human spirit, by 90 art and documentary photographers. William Wegman's Weimaraners created for his children's books. Through July 4. ''Emily Feinstein: Sites Unseen,'' three outdoor sculptures with window openings, to highlight the trees in the sculpture garden and to allow visitors to look inside the structures. Admission: $3; children, free. Katonah Museum of Art, Route 22 at Jay Street. (914) 232-9555.
MOUNT KISCO -- ''Gone Fishin','' juried show. Opens Friday. Through July 30. Northern Westchester Center for the Arts, 272 North Bedford Road. (914) 241-6922.
NEW ROCHELLE -- New Rochelle Art Association's Jules Bauer award show. Reception Friday from 5 to 7 p.m. New Rochelle Public Library, Library Plaza. (914) 632-7878.
PLEASANTVILLE -- Retrospective of art by Raymond deLucia. Through Friday. Mount Pleasant Public Library, 350 Bedford Road. (914) 769-0548.
PORT CHESTER -- ''Michael Simon: Shapes and Surface,'' fired pots by artist. Opening reception Friday from 6 to 8 p.m. Through July 22. Clay Art Center, 40 Beech Street. (914) 937-2047.

PURCHASE -- Whitfield Lovell heads a tour of his installations titled ''Whitfield Lovell: Portrayals.'' Wednesday at noon. Free with museum admission of $4; students and people 62 and older, $3; children, free. Bring bag lunch or buy lunch in museum's cafe. Neuberger Museum of Art, Purchase College. (914) 251-6100.
SHRUB OAK -- Exhibition by members of Northern Westchester Watercolor Society. Through June 29. John C. Hart Memorial Library, 1130 Main Street. (914) 245-5262.
VALHALLA -- ''Summer Palette,'' paintings by 14 artists. Through Sept. 1. Gallery of Macy Pavilion, Westchester Medical Center. (914) 493-8397.

YONKERS -- ''Open Air Sketching: 19th-Century American Landscape Drawings in the Albany Institute of History and Art'' and viewing the recently renovated Glenview Mansion. Wednesdays through Sundays from noon to 5 p.m. and Fridays from 5 to 9 p.m. Admission: $4; people 62 and older and children, $3. Multimedia tours of Glenview Mansion by Emily Trevor, youngest daughter of the family that originally owned the house. Today and next Saturday and Sunday at 1 and 3 p.m. Admission: $7, including museum admission; people 62 and older and children, $5. (Recommended for children 10 through 12.) Hudson River Museum, 511 Warburton Avenue. (914) 963-4550.
LECTURES
BEDFORD -- Latest information on Lyme disease by Susan Tobias of the Lyme Disease Institute. Wednesday at 7 p.m. Free. Westmoreland Sanctuary, 260 Chestnut Ridge Road. (914) 666-8448.

CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- Fred Opie examines Afro-North American labor migration and the Guatemalan railroad worker's league of 1884-1921. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Croton Free Library, 171 Cleveland Drive. (914) 271-6612.

HARRISON -- Lunch meeting with Peter Passidomo, chief court attorney of the Family Court of New York State discussing ''Balancing Justice.'' Presented by League of Women Voters of Harrison. Wednesday at noon. Tickets: $10. Harrison Public Library, Bruce Avenue. (914) 939-7066.

PURCHASE -- ''Animal Empire: Wolves and Wildlife in Portrait.'' Scott Barry shares his observations of wolves, buffalo and other wildlife. Tomorrow at 8 p.m. Friends Meetinghouse, Route 120. (914) 234-7533.

WHITE PLAINS -- Basic Internet lecture, presented by member of library staff. Tomorrow from 7 to 8:30 p.m. ''Genealogy on the Internet,'' demonstration also presented by member of library staff. Wednesday from 7 to 8:30 p.m. Free. White Plains Public Library, 100 Martine Avenue. (914) 422-1480.

YONKERS -- ''On the Streets Where We Live, 1900-2000,'' slide show especially for people 62 and older, by Tom Flynn. Wednesday 1:30 p.m. Cost: $1.50, including museum admission. Hudson River Museum, 511 Warburton Avenue. (914) 963-4550.
FILMS
CHAPPAQUA -- ''Strictly Ballroom.'' Thursday at 7 p.m. Free. Chappaqua Library, 195 South Greeley Avenue. (914) 238-4779.
PEEKSKILL -- ''East-West,'' French and Russian film with English subtitles. Thursday through next Saturday at 8 p.m. $9. Paramount Center, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 739-2333.
CHILDREN

BEDFORD -- Hike in search of salamanders, insects, millipedes and toads, which call the forest floor their home and learn why these animals are important to the health of woodlands. Program for children 6 and older. Today at 2 p.m. Children's nature hike, in search of tracks, deer bones, owl pellets and bird nests. Next Saturday at 2 p.m. Free. Westmoreland Sanctuary, 260 Chestnut Ridge Road. (914) 666-8448.

GREENBURGH -- ''Nature Bugs,'' children 3 and 4 with parent or caregiver take part in nature walk, visiting live animals and making a craft or playing hide and seek. Tomorrow from 1:30 to 2:30 p.m. Rain or shine. Children 3 to 5 and parents enjoy a walk, live animals and stories. Wednesday from 10 to 11 a.m. Admission: $4 each; children, $2. ''Turtle Trek,'' family members search the grounds for turtle treasures. Next Sunday at 2 p.m. Admission: $8, including refreshments and prizes; $5 with pre-paid registration by today. ''Amazing Adaptations,'' natural history exhibit for all ages, focusing on the ways animals and plants adapt to their environment. Hands-on activities and live animals and plants are included. Today from 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., tomorrow through Thursday from 9:30 to 4:30 p.m. and next Saturday and Sunday from 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Admission: $4; students and people 62 and older, $3; children, $2. Greenburgh Nature Center, Dromore Road. (914) 723-3470.
NORTH WHITE PLAINS -- Dragonfly program. Next Saturday at 10 a.m. Free. Cranberry Lake Preserve. (914) 428-1005.

OSSINING -- Kick-off of Jesse Bear Read-to-Me Club, featuring children's entertainer, Graham Clarke. For first graders and younger children. Tuesday at 2 p.m. Free. Ossining Public Library, 53 Croton Avenue. 941-2416.

OSSINING -- Nature by Design, family hike looking at patterns and textures of nature; with leaf, bark and stone rubbings. Next Saturday from 10:30 to 11:30 a.m. Admission: $12 a family; member family, $10. Registration. ''Don't Bug Me!'' Children 8 and 9 scramble on the ground in search of invertebrates. Next Sunday at 1:30 to 2:30 p.m. Admission: $8; members, $6. Registration. Meet at nature center of Teatown Lake Reservation, 1600 Spring Valley Road. (914) 762-2912.

PURCHASE -- ''Art About Town,'' children 5 through 8 take part in art workshops and explore the Neuberger Museum of Art's exhibitions, the college grounds and PepsiCo Sculpture Gardens. June 26 through June 30 from 10 a.m. to noon. Cost: $100; child of museum member, $80. Registration. Purchase College. (914) 251-6100.

SOMERS -- Demonstrations and education about horses. Today from noon to 3 p.m. ''Garden Day,'' program for children 3 through 5. Thursday from 10 to 11 a.m. Cost: $5. Registration. Muscoot Farm, Route 100. (914) 232-7118.

WHITE PLAINS -- Bike and skate Sundays, with Bronx River Parkway closed to vehicular traffic and open to bicyclists and skaters. Today and next Sunday from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. Free. Bicycling course begins at County Center in White Plains and runs south to Scarsdale Road in Yonkers, 14 miles round trip. In-line roller skating course runs north from the County Center to Fisher Lane in North White Plains, two miles round trip. (914) 242-7275.

WHITE PLAINS -- ''Informance,'' Doug Varone and Dancers illustrate how dances are created and the interplay of dance and music. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Free. White Plains Public Library, 100 Martine Avenue. (914) 422-4276.

YONKERS -- Sky shows: ''The Sky Tonight,'' for children 8 and older and adults. Saturdays and Sundays at 1:30 p.m. ''Rusty Rocket's Last Blast,'' for children 6 and older and accompanying adults. Saturdays and Sundays at 2:30 p.m. ''The Start of It All,'' for children 10 and older and adults. Today at 3:30 p.m. ''Earth and Sky,'' for children 8 and older and adults. Next Saturday and Sunday at 3:30 p.m. Tickets: $4 each: people 62 and older and children, $3; one sky show and admission to museum's galleries, $7; people 62 and older and children, $5. ''The Sky Tonight.'' Fridays at 7 p.m., with free tickets at the front desk beginning at 6:30. Hudson River Museum, 511 Warburton Avenue. (914) 963-4550.
POTPOURRI

CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- ''Summer Savories,'' open hearth cooking workshop using authentic 18th-century recipes. Next Saturday from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. Admission: $40, including refreshments and tour of museum; members of Historic Hudson Valley, $35. Registration. 631-8200, ext. 628. ''Sweet Scents, Bitter Pills,'' 18th-century herbal medicine workshop for remedies, sweet scents and the treatment of disease. Next Sunday from 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. Admission: $40, including light refreshments; members of Historic Hudson Valley, $35. Registration. (914) 631-8200, ext. 618. Van Cortlandt Manor.

GARRISON -- Program for Russel Wright collectors and design enthusiasts, with talks, exhibits and panel discussions, ''The Making of Dragon Rock'' and ''Evolution of Iroquois Casual China.'' Next Saturday from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. with cocktail reception at Dragon Rock from 5 to 7 p.m. Tickets: $60. Reservations. Manitoga, Route 9D. (845) 424-3812.
HARTSDALE -- American Kennel Club dog agility show. Today from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. Ridge Road Park. (914) 452-4453.

NYACK -- ''Edward Hopper House Garden Walk,'' self-guided walking tour of the gardens of eight summer estates along the Hudson River. Next Saturday 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Rain or shine. Tickets: $15. Available at Hopper House, 82 North Broadway or at 507 North Broadway in Upper Nyack. (845) 358-0774.

NEW CITY -- ''Leaving Her Mark: A Celebration of Women in Rockland County History,'' exhibition highlighting women from the 18th through 21st centuries. Opens today from 1 to 5 p.m. Thereafter: Tuesdays through Sundays from 1 to 5 p.m. Donation: $4, including free guided tours of Jacob Blauvelt House, an 1830's restoration with Hudson Valley furnishings. Historical Society of Rockland County, 20 Zukor Road. (845) 634-9645.

NEW ROCHELLE -- Indoor summer cycling classes; a 45-minute workout for cardiovascular conditioning. Class for beginners is also offered. Weekdays. Cost: $96 for eight classes; members, $80. Jewish Community Center of Mid-Westchester, 999 Wilmot Road. (914) 472-3300, ext. 326.
OSSINING -- Walking tour of historic Sparta section of Ossining, led by John Lee. Today at 1 p.m. Free. Meet at Jug Tavern, 74 Revolutionary Road.

OSSINING -- Guided tours of Wildflower Island, a two-acre sanctuary, which is home to hundreds of native and endangered species of wildflowers. Saturdays and Sundays at 2 p.m. Admission: $3; members of Teatown, $2; Friends of Wildflower Island, free. (Children 13 and younger are not permitted on the island.) Reservations. Teatown Lake Reservation, 1600 Spring Valley Road. (914) 762-2912.

PUTNAM VALLEY -- Strawberry festival, strawberry shortcake, arts and crafts and flea market. Next Saturday from 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. Tompkins Corners Methodist Church, 729 Peekskill Hollow Road. (845) 528-5076.

TARRYTOWN -- Rockefeller State Park Preserve, featuring woodlands, wetlands, a 24-acre lake and 20 miles of trails (for carriage use originally) for strolling, hiking and nature study. Open daily from 8 a.m. to dusk. Parking: $4 daily; people 62 and older on nonholiday weekdays only, free. Enter on Route 117, a mile east of Route 9, to obtain trail map at visitors center. (Visitors center open daily from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m.) (914) 631-1470.

TARRYTOWN -- Family communications workshop. Learn to listen and communicate more effectively. Thursday 8 to 9:15 p.m. Cost: $18; members, $12. Jewish Community Center, 371 South Broadway. (914) 366-7898.
